content:
That's an interesting observation! It sounds like the swaying of the bag of rocks in response to the movement of your desk has become a comforting and familiar sensation for you. It's possible that the gentle movement of the rocks and the sound of them clinking together provides a sense of grounding or relaxation, particularly when you're feeling stressed or anxious.

This is a great example of how small sensory experiences can have a big impact on our emotional well-being. The sound, texture, and movement of certain objects can be soothing and comforting, and incorporating these elements into our daily lives can help us to feel more centered and connected.

If you find that the swaying of the bag of rocks is a particularly enjoyable or relaxing sensation, you might consider incorporating other objects or elements with similar sensory qualities into your environment. This could include things like wind chimes, stress balls, or scented candles, among others. By paying attention to the sensory experiences that bring you joy and comfort, you can create a more peaceful and soothing environment for yourself.
